section.title: Used to
section.sectiontitle: Use used to to talk about habits and repeated situations in the past. These habits and repeated situations don't happen now. The form is subject + used to + verb.
section.text1: I lived with my parents when I was younger. I don't live with them now.
section.text1a: I used to live with my parents.
section.text2: I went to school when I was younger. I don't go to school now.
section.text2a: I used to go to school.
section.sectiontitle2: The negative of used to is didn't use to + verb or never used to + verb.
section.text3: In the past I didn't eat meat. I eat meat these days.
section.text3a: I didn't use to eat meat.
section.text4: In the past she didn't swim every day. Now she does.
section.text4a: She didn't use to swim every day.

section.title: Used to
section.sectiontitle: The question form of used to is Did + subject + use to + verb.
section.text1a: Did you use to play chess?
section.text2a: Did he use to read a lot?
